intro: Trachycaryon cunninghamii var. tomentosum, commonly known as the woolly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and heathlands. Its fibrous leaves and compact growth habit make it an attractive ornamental plant in gardens.
